ygData.messageBody:
> I appeal to the wisdom of the group once again. I'm a 15th level monk
> starting to assemble a nice set of armor, but I'm a bit naive when it
comes
> to jewelry. Which stat is more valuable to raise with jewelry, DEX or AGI?

Both. :)

> I know agility affects hit points, and the earings I picked up are +2 AGI
> and that's great. But I also got a +2 AGI ring, and I was wondering if I
> should use it to replace one of my trusty Derv rings which are +2
dexterity.

AGI affects AC, and how often things like Dodge and Block go off. Dex
affects your chance to hit. Ideally, you want both high. I tried to
balance my agi and dex out.

> Which affects attack and defense more, dexterity or agility?

agi is defence, dex is attack, I believe.
